Title: When Two Connections Determine the Same Geodesics
AcceptedAnswer:
Assume that the tensor $D$ vanishes. Let $\alpha$ be a geodesic with respect to one of the connections, say $
abla$. Then  $$
abla_TT\equiv 0$$where $T=\dot \alpha$. Using the identity $D\equiv 0$, we get $$ ar
abla_TT=0$$ i.e. the connection $ ar
abla$ has the same geodesic. Conversely, we assume that $
abla$ and $ ar
abla$ have the same geodesics. Let $X$ be any vector field. We will prove that $D$ vanishes point-wise. Let $p\in M$ with nbd $U$ and let $\gamma$ be the geodesic with $\gamma(0)=p,\dot\gamma(0)=X_p$(ODE guarantees that there is a unique such geodesic), then
$$D(X_p,X_p)=(
abla_XX- ar
abla_XX)_p=0$$i.e. $D$ vanishes at $p$ and consequently at every point.
